website_summaries.verdict: A talc-free baby powder that goes on smoothly and keeps your baby clean and dry without irritation.
pros: Talc-free powder with a mild scent
Keeps baby's skin smooth and dry
cons: A little more costly than some of the other products listed here

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Talcum powder isn't safe to use -- BUT hold up! This is a wayyyyy better replacement, anyways! This is one of my go-to toiletry items - it's perfect if you are using the powder for a babies bottom, or - in my case - to help out with sweats as a result from hot flashes! Great for sweaty areas - arm pits, chest area, etc. -- it's a god-send! So, it's one of those: I completely recommend without hesitation!
customer_reviews.author: Liz Hicks

customer_reviews.title: 'Scent" is a dealbreaker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this talc free powder because I was disappointed in Johnson + Johnson for lying about asbestos in their talcum powder (even though i had been buying their cornstarch talc free powder). I wanted to love this product but the texture was not as silky soft as J+J cornstarch - I could have overlooked the texture, but not the scent used in Burt's Bees product - it was awful - medicinal and yucky. I tossed out the remaining 2 unopened containers and the partially used 3rd one - could not get beyond the smell. I have returned to using Johnson + Johnson cornstarch powder.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Zoey

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Use a lot of 'dusting powder' to be more comfortable. Switched to Burt's Bees to try it and I really like it. It has a very pleasant smell and not the baby powder smell. It does a great job at keeping areas dry and odor free like under the breasts etc. I usually put it on before bed and if it's really hot out I may put some on during the day but that's rare. I've now ordered it several times and continue to prefer it over others I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: ButtonsTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this powder before for myself. I cannot use talc and I don't like using plain cornstarch. I used this after radiation treatments to my breast. I used it under the breast to keep it from chafing. It was perfect for that. My treatments are over and I still use it daily. I love the fragrance and the texture. It was delivered on time and in excellent condition.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Scott Blackman

customer_reviews.title: Only Powder We Use!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only powder we will use! We honestly don’t use powder that much. We only use it every now and then if we notice any diaper rash starting accompanied with ointment. I ran out of this and have trouble finding it easily in my area. I had some 100% cornstarch Johnson’s brand powder and used that in the mean time. I started noticing that my little girl was itching like crazy during diaper changes and baths. I stopped using the Johnsons and ordered this from amazon. I’m not going back to Johnson’s EVER! This does not cause itching!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Not the current formula despite the picture
customer_reviews.text: The picture it shows is the current burts bees baby powder, the one I received is the older one. It has different ingredients than the current one. The picture on the left is the one I received, and the one on the right is the one I picked up from babiesrus
customer_reviews.author: Lorie

customer_reviews.title: Horrible powder
customer_reviews.text: The powder was not smooth and silky. Felt just like putting flour on and then when it got sweaty and then dried on my skin it was like glue sticking to my skin and it was also crumbly. It would be cheaper to sprinkle corn starch straight on my body. Did not like at all and would not recommend or put on my baby.
customer_reviews.author: Clarkfam1

customer_reviews.title: Not good baby powder
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea behind using an organic version of baby powder but this particular product was not very good. The powder did not feeling fine enough. When I put it old I have patches of powder clumping. I had to smooth it out a bit more. The scent is not great. I some how accidentally got some in my mouth and noticed a salty taste... not good!! Will try to finish it off since I did pay roughly $8 for it. Will most likely not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Princess

customer_reviews.title: Only baby powder that’s safe to use
customer_reviews.text: This is the only baby powder I will use since it seems all other brands contain talc. Using Burts Bees baby products gives this busy momma one less thing to worry about and keeps my little man dry and comfortable. We have been using this powder since day one and our son is 6 months old now. He rarely ever gets any signs of diaper rash.
customer_reviews.author: Arielle

customer_reviews.title: Strong cheap perfume smell that does not go away.
customer_reviews.text: This stinks like the worst old lady perfume! I think they meant for the fragrance to smell like honey, but instead it smells like cheap floral car freshener. The bad smell does not dilute once you put it on. I read the Amazon reviews that said people were using Burts Bees under arms and other places. It does not work as well as the old school talcum powder you can still get from Johnson and Johnson. Unfortunately, the JJ brand has been linked to cancer. But the Burt's Bee's stuff smells like cheap perfume and does not work. I don't think I would buy either.
customer_reviews.author: rabbit rabbit

customer_reviews.title: Very distinctive smell—did not like
customer_reviews.text: I like Burt's Bee's products in general but I had a visceral reaction to the fragrance of this product. It literally made me sick and I had to throw the bottle away just to get it out of my house. Some people like the smell, but just be aware that there is a very distinctive smell that I could not bear,.
customer_reviews.author: kscoco

customer_reviews.title: Stinks!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's too cheap to bother returning or I would, instead of throwing it away. The smell is just indescribable. It's one of the most offensive odors you can even imagine. Must have been modeled after one of those hanging car things - the vomiting cake scent. No, it most absolutely does NOT smell like baby powder, and for the love of God, do not put this on your kid! I can't speak to texture or comfort, as I couldn't get past the stench.
customer_reviews.author: Summer Hater

customer_reviews.title: Talc alternative for babies or adults!
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this for myself (age 48, no more babies in my house!) I use baby powder sometimes after the shower and became really concerned lately about the link between talc and cancer. I searched online for an alternative and decided to give this a try even though it is marked as a baby product. It works perfectly and is a nice size bottle. I actually looked for it at Target and my supermarket before ordering online but could not find it so I'm very glad Amazon had it!
customer_reviews.author: ELF

customer_reviews.title: Smells great
customer_reviews.text: Noticeable pleasant smell. One of the ingredients is lemon, I don't know if it affects baby's bums if there's a bad rash, but the smell is wonderful, and is useful for more than baby bums. This particular purchase (3x 7.5 oz bottles) is well worth the price ans definitely the cheapest ive found.
customer_reviews.author: sarah brook

customer_reviews.title: Not for men
customer_reviews.text: The scent is just not something a man wants to smell like. Great scent for a woman. My wife loved the feel of it. Big fan of Burts Bees products. Their lip balm is second to none. Any guy reading this that wants a cornstarch non-talc body powder will be very happy with Gold Bond Ultimate in the whole container. Definitely a scent a man would be comfortable with. There is another Gold Bond cornstarch non-talc body powder out there. It is in a brown/bronze container. I am not paying that outrageous price when the white container is great and so much better priced.
customer_reviews.author: Big DaddyBlues

customer_reviews.title: Well made talc free powder
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a fan of a lot of Burt's Bee's baby toiletries' line, but this is one product I absolutely love. The scent is great, and it definitely helps keep the diaper rash at bay. It's relatively sheer, but for good absorbency when applied generously. One bottle lasts me a little over a month, but I tend to overuse it. Of course, what I'm most happy about is that the ingredients are good and its scent is not too strong. It's a little more expensive that some other brands, but overall, I'm very happy with this powder.
customer_reviews.author: Debounce

customer_reviews.title: Smells amazimg.
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Switched from regular baby powder to this to avoid cancer. Was hesitant as I use baby powder often for dry shampoo, and after spray tanning. This smells soooooo good. Like wow . Way better than baby powder. And smells less chemically too. Feels like baby powder texture very light very fine. You don't have to use very much either a little really does go a long way. More than w baby powder
customer_reviews.author: Karly Kim

customer_reviews.title: The perfect dry shampoo!
customer_reviews.text: Not only do I use this on my baby, but it is the BEST DRY SHAMPOO! I have tried a few different organic powders and different combinations to make my own dry shampoo, but this stuff I can just use as is. It gives my hair amazing volume and absorbs the grease if I am trying to stretch between washes. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tim & Riss Patnode

customer_reviews.title: Don't like the smell
customer_reviews.text: When I put this on before bed to feel smooth and fresh, I find that it kind of chokes me, and the smell is unpleasant to me. I guess we're all used to the familiar scent of baby powder, and this is very different, and not in a good way. It also kind of forms a paste on my skin if there's dampness. I'm sorry I have 3 containers of it now! Yes, safer than talc. But I also want it to feel and smell better.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Uyemura

customer_reviews.title: I didn't like it
customer_reviews.text: keeping it simple... The scent,quantity and price is good but the powder gets stuck like a some spots on the skin... too much dryness
customer_reviews.author: Divya

customer_reviews.title: Great powder for adults too
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my adult self after hearing warners regarding traditional powders and a link to cancers, specifically ovarian cancer. Surprising (to me) I LOVE the smell. It is indeed like a light honey. It's very mild, but there. The powder itself works well and leaves my skin dry and soft. I will definately continue to use this product.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Like powder without talc
customer_reviews.text: I use this for myself and I wanted something without talc and I found this one. It smells fresh with a soft scent.. It is finely ground so it’s comfortable to use. I use many other Burt’s Bees products so I thought I would try this. I bought one then went back and bought this 3 pack. So I will have it for awhile. Happy with this product as I am with my other Burt’s Bees products.
customer_reviews.author: LCM

customer_reviews.title: Reaction to fragrance
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend going for a non sented powder for a babies bottom, my son had a bad reaction to this powder. Bought a generic brand that’s talc free and aloe infused and it worked much better. Note; my son has eczema so is sensitive in general.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin M.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing fragrance & perfect texture!
customer_reviews.text: This is the healthiest, all natural, and talc-free version of baby powder I could find. I worried I’d waste money, but I was so wrong! I LOVE the light fragrance and smoothness in texture!!! It smells like honey, and I get Van Morrison’s song Tupelo Honey in my head every time I use it! This is perfect for my summer baby, and I’ll definitely be buying more for our baby’s changing table.😊
customer_reviews.author: Amy Sanderson

customer_reviews.title: I forgot I really really don't like this product.  I threw it out.
customer_reviews.text: Well, let's see. I don't like the scent, don't know why, just don't like it. And then the powder sort of clumps and solidifies, and is easiest to scrape off with a fingernail. So I went to the grocery store and bought the Johnson and Johnson CORNSTARCH lavender baby powder, smells good, works fine. I don't think highly of Johnson and Johnson; they knew decades ago that talc causes cancer, and still sell it. Why did they not switch all their baby powders to cornstarch?
customer_reviews.author: Vee Wardwell

customer_reviews.title: The only baby powder for me!
customer_reviews.text: On principle, my husband and I refuse to purchase Johnson & Johnson baby powder, so we opted to try Burt's Bees powder when our son arrived in April 2019. This powder is so soft and has not irritated my baby's skin in the slightest. It is smooth going on, silky when rubbed into the skin, and clumps only slightly in the creases of his legs (but is very easily wiped away without smearing or being pushed around). We love this powder and have purchased a 3pack on three separate occasions since our initial purchase in April. Love love love this powder!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Heals minor diaper rash/redness
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this dusting powder for almost a year. I like that the scent is very mild, it does not cake when the diaper is wet, and it's a very fine powder. She has never had a full blown diaper rash, but it does clear up redness nicely. Usually pretty high priced wherever I have purchased, wish it was a little less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Smells great and works well
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge fan of Burt's Bees and their products. I absolutely love the scent of their baby powder, it's a refreshing smell. I know their products are pricey, but the quality of their products outweigh the price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product. Can’t find in stores
customer_reviews.text: The ONLY baby powder I like and use. No talc! My son has always had sensitive skin. We tried everything, both prescription and OTC. Once I started using this, all his issues went away. Yes, it is grainy. I use a large makeup brush to dust it on him rather than just dump it on him. I haven’t been able to find it in any stores since babies r us closed. Thanks amazon!!
customer_reviews.author: Mamabear1414

customer_reviews.title: Happy I gave it a try.
customer_reviews.text: Great for sensitive skin! This has a little bit heavier granules compared to original type baby powder. Descent is a little different than I'm used to, but I'm okay with it. It took a day or two to get used to. I'm happy I gave it a chance. A little bit pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Mrs Cox

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it but...
customer_reviews.text: I like that it’s talc free and you get a good amount for the price especially considering it’s natural. However I can’t get past the smell. The smell is so very particular, and does not have “fresh” scent that you would expect it to have. It smells almost like spoiled candy or something. Unfortunately I will not be ordering it again due to the scent.
customer_reviews.author: Noneya Bisniss

customer_reviews.title: Strong Smell
customer_reviews.text: I love all the Burt's Bees products I have tried except this one. Applied it before bed at night to help with night sweats and woke up 5 times due to the strong unpleasant order. I could not wait to wash it off in the morning and have relegated it to the barn where I will sprinkle it around plants to deter bugs. I cannot attest to the absorbency because I could not get past the odor.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Just Expensive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dusting powder for my baby mainly because it is talc free due to what is going on with J&J. I like the scent and the absorbancy; however, i feel that basic talc free powder from any other company can do the same job. paying $20 for 3 bottles vs $3 per bottle of J&J doesnt make much sense to me.
customer_reviews.author: Sajid Shaikh

customer_reviews.title: Love this power
customer_reviews.text: Love this power. Ever since the Johnson & Johnson brand was linked to cancer and the lawsuits because of the talc, I immediately switched to this brand and have been using it ever since. You can’t put a price on health, and for that I will continue to buy this product, it works well....I use it for my baby and myself ❤️
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They get the job done - I highly recommend this set
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for adults (not just babies). The scent is very pleasing and it gets the job done when it comes to absorbing moisture throughout the day.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M

customer_reviews.title: very smelly
customer_reviews.text: The powder itself is nice if you can get past the strong smell. The container says that it is a "natural fragrance" but it is too intense. The combination of ingredients are effective for the powder and feel soft and dry on your skin.
customer_reviews.author: PKR

customer_reviews.title: Great for the value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dog since he recently had surgery on his knee and his groin was very irritated from them shaving all the surrounding fur. This works well, but it could stay on longer. I have to reapply it several times a day. Also the smell is nice but kind of strong.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, comfortable body powder
customer_reviews.text: Burt's Bees Dusting Powder is good for just about anyone. I experienced it as having a delicate almond scent. It goes on smooth as silk unlike another produce that advertises itself as comfortable, but feels like fine sand when poured into your hand. I have yet to find anything I do not like about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Get it while it lasts
customer_reviews.text: Trying not to go with J&Johnsons so we decided to give this a try. It was at about $20 but now it's getting higher. Barely a scent, which is fine with me, great absorbency, and I hope it doesn't get more expensive. If it does, I don't think I'll be buying anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Claudina

customer_reviews.title: Not really useful....
customer_reviews.text: I give 5 stars for the item because the absorbency is good for wet skin but 1 star for useful. My daughter’s doctor suggested me ”you have to be careful when you apply powder on baby, in the case she may breath it in. I suggest you better not use it and get a cream instead”.Also, It smells good but I'm not sure its good for baby.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Made baby bottom bright red and bit
customer_reviews.text: Does not absorb diaper moisture... turned my babies bum bright red. I was previously using J&J which was working great, but I usually love burt's bees products and wanted to give it a try. After each diaper change, it looked like I had out flour on my baby. Did not absorb but created a paste and made diaper rash worse! I just purchased more talc free J&J and will keep using that.
customer_reviews.author: ChristinaRa

customer_reviews.title: Smells nice, but gave babies a rash
customer_reviews.text: Good amount of product for the price. It has a soft, pleasant lemon scent. The texture of the powder is soft. However, it gave both my newborn and two year old a bright red, painful rash. I will definitely not be using it on their skin again. Now I need to figure out alternative uses for baby powder because I would hate to have to toss it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie LaCroix

customer_reviews.title: Bad scent, but does it's job. Likely won't buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely hating the fruity smell (scent), but the powder itself is decently functional. Does it's job, just reeks in a way I personally find nauseating. Overall, meh. To each their own, I'm generally pretty sensitive to smells so should've seen this coming. Gonna finish the one open bottle and donate the other two. Likely won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca M.

customer_reviews.title: Clear up behind the knee eczema
customer_reviews.text: I have not use powder for a long time because the claim that powder affect your breathing. Well, this powder cure my son’s behind the knee eczema. My son has been suffering eczema for years. Steroid cream would not help this spot. Doctor said she did not know, keep applying steroid. I went research websites to websites, and finally someone mentioned of powder for body crease. Then I researched which powder will benefit his angry skin. This powder does it job. Its smell does not bother me or my son. It absorbs well. I can see his healthy skin again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic scent and keeps baby dry!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite baby powder! It smells so fresh and way better than the "traditional" baby powder smell! It's smooth on baby's skin and does a great job of keeping her dry. It's quite absorbent but doesn't get cakey. It's my preferred powder by a large margin!
customer_reviews.author: LizzyBru

customer_reviews.title: Smells really bad!
customer_reviews.text: This smells BAD!!! We bought it and our daughter said, what’s the point of powder if it’s so stinky?!? 😂 will not be buying again. We got it because it’s all natural and we wanted that. But it’s an ordeal while the smell lasts.
customer_reviews.author: NorCal buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great and lets hope not toxic powder compared to other brands
customer_reviews.text: If its not harmful to the body without my knowledge this was a great powder purchase! I have been lost without lavender Johnson and Johnson since I no longer use them at all. But this is a great and comforting powder. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: John W Snyder

customer_reviews.title: No allergy issues!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great. I used it on myself and found that I have no allergy issues. I have been looking for something like this, and I am sure that I found it.
customer_reviews.author: Shaolin

customer_reviews.title: Quality powder
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy J&J again after reading what they did in the news so I was in search of a new papa powder for my grand babies. I live this powder. It’s very soft and it smells good. It’s absorbent too. It’s a little pricey but it’s worth it in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: V. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Works well, talc free, just wish it was without the fragrance ingredient
customer_reviews.text: I love that this powder is talc free. I use it every day on my son to keep him dry & to prevent diaper rash. It works well & had a nice sent. I'm giving it 4 stars bc it does have fragrance in it which I'm not a fan of. It smells nice, but I'd rather it not have the fragrance.
customer_reviews.author: blbupstate

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. I use it on my feet in the summertime when I need a little extra dryness as well as a dry shampoo for blonde hair. I like that it’s all natural
customer_reviews.author: mel

customer_reviews.title: Great smell and dispenses the right amount of powder st ...
customer_reviews.text: Great smell and dispenses the right amount of powder st a time. The Johnson and Johnson powder bottles dispense too much powder at once and makes it more likely for baby to breathe in powder.
customer_reviews.author: GRocha

customer_reviews.title: good but strong scent
customer_reviews.text: I love this powder, does a good job, but is very strongly scented. Not a bad scent, just too much of it. But, it's not talc, which we want to stay away from.
customer_reviews.author: Shineyshine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this powder to avoid the talc sometimes found in other powders. I use it on my newborn and really love the scent and the size of the bottle. It's very easy to wrangle the baby and apply the powder at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: MrsFTeach

customer_reviews.title: Great Powder!!!
customer_reviews.text: We use this powder daily to help fight moisture in our baby’s diapers. It keeps her skin from getting irritated which keeps her happy. We love the burts bees baby products!
customer_reviews.author: C. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: I’m obsessed!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this baby powder! I’ve bought it for my daughter several times and I love that it doesn’t have talc in it. It smells so nice and is not overly scented. Perfect size bottle to take on the go or leave at home.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Good for absorbency but irritated my baby’s skin
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about the powder. I gave it a 2 star for the scent was a little too strong for me. On the other hand I gave it a 4 star for the absorbency part. My biggest problem with the product was that it irritated my baby’s skin and she now has rashes around her neck. I think it’s great powder but not for my LO.
customer_reviews.author: Winy

customer_reviews.title: Defective Top
customer_reviews.text: First one arrived with top off, powder everywhere. Replacement has defective top too. I give up. Will try to get another container so we can use the powder.
customer_reviews.author: teatime

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the value
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these after searching for talc free baby powder. We never use much anyway, so these containers should last us a loooooong time. They are much larger than the 11 dollar honest company talc free powder. Happy with the value!
customer_reviews.author: Erica Boone

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It works great! The baby was 1 week old and started getting diaper rash. We bought a cream that works great, then week two I thought, “I remembered using baby powder on my cousin.” So we wanted a safe alternative instead of what we grew up with. This stuff works great and the baby doesn’t need the cream anymore. This is week 4.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy Shark

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: It was supposed to be a three pack. I only recieved one. I'm not happy. I order two three packs and got one in each pack! I'm furious!
customer_reviews.author: moore

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I normally love Burt’s Bee’s products but I was disappointed in this powder. I was looking for a powder with corn starch because I have MS and I suffer from heat intolerance due to it and unfortunately sweat a lot! First I do not like the fragrance! It actually turns my stomach when I use it. Also it does not feel as soothing as regular powder with cornstarch - somewhat gritty. I am doubly disappointed because I purchased the 3 pack! 😢
customer_reviews.author: Sambolee

customer_reviews.title: Not fond of scent
customer_reviews.text: The powder is very nice but the scent is very sweet. I don't know if they were going for honey smell or what, but I disliked it enough to not buy it again. However, that's me. You may like it or love it.
customer_reviews.author: Caveat Emptor

customer_reviews.title: Misleading advertising
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected. Too many ingredients, no cornstarch, fragrant smell, not good for diaper rash! I’m sending it back. Bought Publix brand pure cornstarch powder.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Kimbrough

customer_reviews.title: Picky husband was happy
customer_reviews.text: My husband was using baby powder every day, (and had been for 38+ years) and I switched him to this powder without complaint. 'Nuff said.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Fresh and Dry
customer_reviews.text: Not just for babies...Great for adults who are wanting to feel fresh and remain dry especially during hot 105 degree summer heat...without the ingredient (talc or talcum) which is very harmful in other powders.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Evans

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL
customer_reviews.text: AWFUL. Bottle arrived open. Not broken, open, so they didn’t tighten up the lid. Powder was ALL OVER package. Made a mess when I opened it. Smelled bad.
customer_reviews.author: Hiramia Milán

customer_reviews.title: Better ingredients than baby powder
customer_reviews.text: Talc free and smells amazing. I use it for my daughter as well as dry shampoo, and even under my arms if I get sweaty and don’t want to apply more deodorant. (I use aluminum free deodorant so I tend to sweat more) no rash’s ever. Awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Dhurley405

customer_reviews.title: Highest quality talc-free baby powder!
customer_reviews.text: I am a big Burt’s Bees fan and absolutely love their Baby Bee Dusting Powder! It works well, has a very nice and subtle scent, and is completely talc-free with natural substitution of corn starch. I definitely recommend this product not just for the high quality but because the worry free formula it provides.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad scent, gritty product, gets cakey!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible scent that is really strong. Powder is really gritty, not at all silky. Powder gets cakey.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: We wanted an alternate to your big name baby powders and this one is amazing. It doesn’t have any chemicals or talc in it. It has camomile which leaves a nice smell without irritating baby’s skin. Our daughter hasn’t had any reactions. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Good price, smells good not too strong! Absorbs excess moisture.
customer_reviews.text: Smells good, not to strong! does what it's supposed to and doesn't irritate my son's skin, we used it in his diaper to absorb excess moisture during the summer. :)
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly fair

customer_reviews.title: Baby got a bad rash after using this powder
customer_reviews.text: We used the powder for about 2 weeks. After the first week, my daughter started to get red spots on her tushy. By the second week it turned into an awful rash. 0/10, would not recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
